snippet: When 18 students started twitching, parents suspected the environment. The answer turned out to be much more complex.
abstract: Mysterious ailment afflicting 18 students in Le Roy, NY, leads parents to suspect the environment was responsible for children's odd symptoms, like uncontrollable twitching and muscle spasms; repeated tests of both the environment and children result in something far more complex; illness is a combination of conversion disorder, in which stress is subconsciously converted into physical symptoms, and mass psychogenic illness, both of which are poorly understood.
lead_paragraph: When 18 students started twitching, parents suspected the environment. The answer turned out to be much more complex.

headline.seo: The Mystery of 18 Twitching Teenagers in Le Roy
headline.main: What Happened to the Girls in Le Roy
headline.print_headline: What Happened to the Girls in Le Roy
